Grilled Chicken Salad

Jump to Recipe

Are you looking for a healthy and delicious meal that’s perfect for lunch or dinner? Look no further than this mouthwatering Grilled Chicken Salad! Packed with vibrant mixed greens, juicy cherry tomatoes, and crisp cucumber, this salad not only tantalizes your taste buds but also provides a nutritious punch. The star of the dish, grilled chicken breast, is seasoned to perfection, offering a smoky flavor that complements the fresh ingredients beautifully. Whether you’re aiming for a lighter meal or simply want to indulge in a satisfying bowl of goodness, this recipe is quick and easy to prepare, making it ideal for busy weeknights or meal prep. Plus, it’s customizable to suit your preferences! Dive into this delightful salad that’s sure to become a favorite in your household.

Ingredients

chicken breast

Choose boneless, skinless chicken breasts for ease of preparation. For added flavor, marinate the chicken in olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, and herbs for at least 30 minutes before grilling. If you prefer, you can substitute chicken thighs for a juicier option, but adjust cooking time accordingly.

mixed salad greens

Use a mix of different greens like arugula, spinach, romaine, and kale for varied textures and flavors. If you don’t have mixed greens, you can substitute with any leafy greens you enjoy, such as iceberg or butter lettuce. Wash and dry the greens thoroughly to avoid a soggy salad.

cherry tomatoes

Opt for ripe cherry tomatoes for the best flavor; they should be firm and shiny. If cherry tomatoes are not available, you can substitute them with grape tomatoes or diced regular tomatoes. Roasting the tomatoes before adding them to the salad can enhance their sweetness.

cucumber

Choose a firm cucumber and slice it thinly for better texture. English cucumbers are great for salads as they are less bitter and have fewer seeds. If you want more flavor, try pickling the cucumber slices in vinegar for a few minutes before adding them to the salad.

red onion

Thinly sliced red onion adds a nice crunch and sharpness to the salad. If the flavor is too strong, soak the slices in cold water for about 10 minutes to mellow them out. You can substitute with shallots or green onions for a milder taste.

olive oil

Use extra virgin olive oil for a richer flavor. If you need a substitute, avocado oil or canola oil can be used, but they won’t provide the same richness. For a twist, infuse your oil with herbs or garlic beforehand.

balsamic vinegar

Select high-quality balsamic vinegar for the best flavor. If you don’t have it, red wine vinegar or apple cider vinegar can be used as a substitute, but they will change the flavor profile slightly. For added sweetness, you can mix in a teaspoon of honey or maple syrup.

salt

Use kosher salt for seasoning as it’s easier to control. If you are watching sodium intake, opt for a salt substitute or reduce the amount used. Remember to season the chicken and salad appropriately to enhance overall flavor.

pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper offers the best flavor; consider using a mix of black and white pepper for added depth. For a kick, try adding some crushed red pepper flakes or a dash of cayenne pepper to the dressing.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Grill

    Preheat your grill or grill pan over medium-high heat for about 10 minutes. This ensures a good sear on the chicken, locking in juices and flavor.

  • Step 2: Season the Chicken

    Take the 2 pieces of chicken breast and season them generously with salt and pepper. Drizzle a tablespoon of olive oil over the chicken to help the seasoning stick and to prevent sticking on the grill.

  • Step 3: Grill the Chicken

    Place the seasoned chicken breasts on the hot grill. Grill for about 5-7 minutes on each side. The chicken is done when it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (75°C) and is no longer pink inside.

  • Step 4: Prepare the Salad

    While the chicken is grilling, wash and prepare your salad. In a large bowl, combine 4 cups of mixed salad greens, 1 cup of halved cherry tomatoes, 1 sliced cucumber, and 1/4 thinly sliced red onion. Toss gently to mix.

  • Step 5: Make the Dressing

    In a separate small bowl, whisk together 2 tablespoons of olive oil, 2 tablespoons of balsamic vinegar, and season with salt and pepper to taste. This dressing adds a tangy flavor that complements the grilled chicken.

  • Step 6: Slice the Chicken

    Once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the grill and let it rest for about 5 minutes. This resting period allows the juices to redistribute. After resting, slice the chicken into strips.

  • Step 7: Assemble the Salad

    Top the prepared salad with the sliced grilled chicken. Drizzle the balsamic dressing over the salad just before serving.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I know when the chicken is fully cooked?

Chicken is fully cooked when it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (75°C). You can use a meat thermometer to check this. Alternatively, cut into the thickest part of the chicken; there should be no pink meat and the juices should run clear.

What’s the best way to season chicken?

A simple seasoning of salt and pepper works well, but you can add other spices or a marinade for extra flavor. Just remember to apply seasoning evenly on both sides before cooking.

What can I do if I don't have a grill?

If you don’t have a grill, you can use a grill pan on the stove or even bake the chicken in the oven at 400°F (200°C) for about 20-25 minutes.

How can I make sure my salad dressing is well mixed?

Whisking the olive oil and balsamic vinegar together in a small bowl will help emulsify the dressing. You can also put them in a jar with a lid and shake it vigorously.

Is it safe to eat raw vegetables in my salad?

Yes, raw vegetables are safe to eat, but always wash them thoroughly under running water to remove any dirt or pesticides.

How do I slice the chicken properly?

Let the grilled chicken rest for a few minutes after cooking. Then, place it on a cutting board and slice it against the grain into strips. This will help keep the chicken tender.

How can I make my salad more filling?

You can add ingredients like avocado, nuts, cheese, or even grains such as quinoa or farro to make your salad more filling.

What can I do with leftover salad dressing?

Store leftover dressing in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week. Shake well before using it again.

Can I use other vegetables in my salad?

Absolutely! Feel free to add your favorite vegetables like bell peppers, carrots, or radishes. Just be sure to wash and chop them appropriately.

What if I don’t have balsamic vinegar?

If you don’t have balsamic vinegar, you can substitute it with apple cider vinegar or red wine vinegar. You can add a bit of honey or sugar to mimic the sweetness of balsamic.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This salad is naturally gluten-free and can be made low-carb by omitting the dressing or using a low-carb alternative. For a dairy-free option, ensure the dressing is free of any dairy. To make it vegetarian, replace the grilled chicken with grilled tofu or chickpeas, and consider adding a variety of beans for extra protein.

Pairings

For a delightful pairing with Grilled Chicken Salad, consider serving it with a light, crisp white wine such as Sauvignon Blanc or a refreshing rosé. For a non-alcoholic option, a sparkling water infused with lemon or cucumber enhances the fresh flavors. If adding protein, grilled shrimp or salmon can complement the salad beautifully.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Grilled Chicken Salad in wide, shallow bowls to showcase the vibrant colors of the ingredients. Garnish with extra cherry tomatoes and a sprinkle of fresh herbs like basil or parsley for added color and flavor. For a touch of crunch, consider adding toasted nuts or seeds, such as sliced almonds or sunflower seeds. Serve the dressing on the side for guests to customize their serving.

Grilled Chicken Salad

25 min
$10
350 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 2

Dietary Tags:

Gluten-FreeLow-CarbHigh-Protein

Cuisine:

AmericanHealthy

Course:

Main CourseSalad

Tags:

QuickHealthyLight

Description

A refreshing mix of grilled chicken, crisp greens, and vibrant veggies, topped with a light dressing.

Ingredients

  • chicken breast: 2 pieces
  • mixed salad greens: 4 cups
  • cherry tomatoes: 1 cup
  • cucumber: 1, sliced
  • red onion: 1/4, thinly sliced
  • olive oil: 2 tablespoons
  • balsamic vinegar: 2 tablespoons
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste

Date Created:

11/17/2024
